summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 between a federal prosecutor and law enforcement personnel regarding discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The prosecutor requests a wide range of evidence including FBI 302s, photographs, search warrant returns, and data from seized devices related to the Epstein investigation and Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery request; the prosecution is gathering materials to provide to her defense counsel as part of the legal process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in relation to the investigation of his properties in New York and the US Virgin Islands, from which evidence was seized.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in a case stemming from the Epstein investigation; the discovery materials being gathered include evidence seized from Epstein's properties.

events.title: Scheduled Discovery Call
events.description: A call was proposed for the week of July 27, 2020, to discuss discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The prosecution was actively gathering extensive discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case in July 2020, including FBI 302s, photographs, search warrant returns, and data from seized electronic devices.
The requested materials specifically included evidence from searches of Jeffrey Epstein's residences in New York and the US Virgin Islands.
The correspondence indicates coordination between an Assistant United States Attorney and members of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The prosecutor's request highlights the scale of digital evidence, noting photo files were 'quite large' and some materials would need to be provided on DVD or thumb drive.
